timeline.bodyText: chatted offline - I personally don't like this structure of using abstract classes; would prefer if this was a final class that you call methods on directly.

timeline.bodyText: nit: can we call this TimelockCorruptionTestConstants or similar? I know it is in the test project, but I'm wary of such a generic name here

timeline.bodyText:
the javadoc is a note, of sorts. I'd recommend refactoring this line as follows:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Note - All tests only induce and detect one type of corruption check violation -> ACCEPTED_VALUE_GREATER_THAN_LEARNED
          
          
            
             * All tests only induce and detect ACCEPTED_VALUE_GREATER_THAN_LEARNED corruption.

replies.bodyText:
With this method, either 1 or 0 detected violations are passed, which I'm not a fan of at all. I'd prefer if you separate out to two methods: one that takes a single violation and confirms it is there, and a second where the logic is essentially:
assertThat(getViolationsToNamespaceToUseCaseMultimap()).isEmpty();
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: you can inline this variable - the method call is actually shorter than the variable!
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText:
IntelliJ tells me that there are a number of methods that can be private - please make them private, then re-order so that they are after the non-private ones.
Also, there are definitely some methods that can be static - for example writeLogsOnServer. Please make static the methods that can be.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText:
Interesting - if we get an exception on startup, we don't want to do anything? I'd have thought we'd do:
throw new RuntimeException(throwable, "failed on startup");
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: Same as elsewhere: this and other methods don't need to be public.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: nit: static?
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: there are others in this class too
replies.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: name - add 'inclusive'
timeline.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: It is only used in one place but I think this signature makes sense.
timeline.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: As far as I can tell, every test uses the params 1, 10. Perhaps you should mix this up a bit? Can these numbers be large (e.g. 10k)? Might help to catch any funny errors to have at least one test with large numbers - if that makes sense in prod.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: First part is done. For the second part I can add a (stress?) test in CorruptionDetectionIntegrationTest.
replies.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: nit: reorder the methods so that public is at the top, private at the bottom (and if it makes sense to group static methods, feel free to do that too).
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: nit: In other tests, you statically imported this. Either do the same here, or remove the static imports elsewhere.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
